paradigmAffinities.lore: Wood remembers the forest. Buildings of wood feel alive.
Stone endures. Runes carved in stone last longest.
Ice preserves and slows. Time moves differently in frozen halls.
Metal channels power. Allomancers feel its pull.
Marble speaks of grandeur. Gods favor temples of white stone.
Granite resists all change. Runes carved here are nearly eternal.
Clay holds the potential for life. Breath mages value it.
Bamboo bends but does not break. Spirits rest in bamboo forests.
Gold never tarnishes. Divine beings favor its incorruptible nature.
Silver is the moon\'s metal. It wards against darkness and corruption.
Copper clouds Allomantic pulses. Smokers prize pure copper.
Bronze detects Allomantic pulses. Seekers can sense magic through bronze.
Iron is anathema to the fae. It grounds magic and repels spirits.
Steel pushes. Coinshots hurl steel through the air.
Mithril is stronger than steel yet light as silk. Magic flows through it like water.
Adamantine cannot be broken. Reality itself yields before it does.

paradigmAffinities.description: Legendary golden-red metal that glows faintly
paradigmAffinities.lore: The metal of Atlantis. Orichalcum amplifies all magic tenfold.
Diamonds focus magic to a razor point. Precision spells benefit most.
Rubies burn with inner fire. They amplify emotions and blood magic.
Sapphires bring clarity and wisdom. Scholars prize them for focused study.
Emeralds hold the essence of life. Healers and nature mages treasure them.
Amethyst opens the dreaming eye. Prophets sleep upon amethyst pillows.
Topaz attracts fortune and success. Merchants keep topaz in their coffers.
Opal is chaos crystallized. Its magic is powerful but unpredictable.
Pearls form from irritation transformed to beauty. They teach patience.
Jade bridges the living and the dead. Ancestors speak through jade carvings.
Obsidian reflects truth. Blood mages carve their blades from it.
Crystal focuses and amplifies magic. Mana pools around crystal formations.
Quartz remembers. Sympathy mages use quartz to store connections.
Buildings of flesh are abominations—or miracles
Bone holds echoes of life. Necromancers build temples of bone.
Chitin is the armor of the hive. Insectoid minds feel at home.
Webs catch more than flies. Promises made in web-draped halls bind tighter.
Bees build in wax. Their collective consciousness leaves traces.
Fungi connect everything underground. The mycelium network carries whispers.
Living wood breathes. Elven buildings of living wood are one with the forest.
Amber traps moments in time. Memories stored in amber never fade.
Ivory carries the wisdom of great beasts. Their spirits may linger.
Feathers remember flight. Buildings of feather feel light as dreams.
Dragon scales are nearly indestructible and hold traces of draconic power.
Candy buildings exist where belief is strong. Children\'s dreams make them real.
Chocolate is love made solid. Buildings of chocolate radiate warmth.
Gingerbread houses are built by witches—or grandmothers. Sometimes both.
Cake buildings collapse unless maintained by constant belief—or magic.
Ice cream buildings exist in the dreams of summer. They melt in harsh reality.
Mouse dreamers build castles of cheese. Some are quite elaborate.
Bread is sacred in many faiths. Bread buildings are blessed spaces.
Sugar crystals refract light into rainbows. Pure sweetness made solid.
Honey is the labor of thousands. It holds community and preservation.
Salt is the universal ward. No evil spirit willingly crosses a salt line.
Void is not emptiness—it is the absence of existence itself.
Light made solid is a miracle. Only the most devoted can shape it.
Darkness given form hides all within. What lurks inside is unknown.
Dream-stuff is the raw material of imagination. It can become anything.
Nightmare buildings exist at the edge of madness. Fear made architecture.
Time itself
Memory made solid. Walk through and experience the past.
Raw emotion given form. The building itself feels.
Pure thought made real. Within
Music frozen in the moment of perfection. The building hums eternally.
Silence is the canvas on which name magic is painted.
Buildings of pages contain all the knowledge written on them.
Ink carries intention. Words written in ink have power.
Starlight falls from infinity. It carries the weight of distances.
Moonlight is the sun\'s reflection. It sees what daylight cannot.
Sunlight is truth. Nothing hides in buildings of solid sun.
Shadows are the absence of light—yet here they have substance.
Mist blurs boundaries. In mist buildings
Smoke rises to the heavens. It is the vehicle of offerings.
Ash is the ghost of fire. It holds memories of destruction.
Dust is time made visible. Ancient places are thick with it.
Fire that burns without fuel. It is will made manifest.
Water that holds form. It flows in slow motion
Air given boundaries. Within
Earth in its platonic form. Unshakeable foundation.
Lightning frozen in the moment of strike. Raw power contained.
The blood of the earth itself. Dwarf forges are built over magma.
Steam is transformation. Water becoming air.
Frost that never melts. It preserves all within.
Technology sufficiently advanced is indistinguishable from magic.
Information given form. The building knows everything within it.
The fourth state of matter
Pure force
Tiny machines that rebuild and adapt. The building heals itself.
Pewter grants physical might. Thugs feel stronger near pure pewter.
Tin sharpens the senses. Tineyes see in darkest night.
Zinc inflames emotions. Rioters use it to enrage or terrify.
Brass calms emotions. Soothers bring peace—or apathy.
Chromium drains Allomantic reserves. Leechers are feared.
Nicrosil enhances another\'s Allomantic burn.
Aluminum is immune to Allomancy. It blocks pushes and pulls.
Duralumin burns all your metals in one explosive moment.
Atium is Ruin\'s body. Burning it grants precognition.
Lerasium is Preservation\'s body. Consuming it makes one Mistborn.
The Stone transmutes lead to gold and grants eternal life. Few have made it.
Before creation
The stuff of gods. To touch it is to touch the infinite.
The raw material of souls. Breath mages can shape it into life.
Ectoplasm is the physical manifestation of ghostly presence.
Blood is life. Buildings of blood are alive in the darkest way.
Tears of joy and sorrow
Breath is life force given form. Awakeners can invest it into objects.
Every book is a door to another mind. A library is a palace of doors.
Ancient wisdom preserved in coiled form.
The medium upon which contracts are bound.
The finest writing surface
The medium of pharaohs and priests.
Each rune is a word of power
Glyphs guard and ward
A sigil is a cage for names and a key for doors.
Grimoires contain not just spells
Echoes remember what was said
Whispers are secrets that refuse to die.
Mana crystallized by will alone. Priceless to any mage.
Time that stopped and forgot to start again.
What is thought but energy? This is thought made matter.
The rage of storms
Moonbeams woven by patient hands under a full moon.
Fear given form. It remembers every nightmare that made it.
Joy so pure it refused to fade
Sorrow distilled to its essence. Strangely beautiful.
The stuff before creation
The principle of order itself
Forged in dragonfire with blood magic
Frozen fire from the dawn of days.
Forged in stellar cores and delivered by comets.
Quicksilver blessed under a hundred full moons.
Each blade whispers with the screams of those within.
Oaths sworn on oathgold cannot be broken without consequence.
Cold-forged iron
Thunderbolt iron
Darksteel endures. It has no choice.
Etherium flows with the essence of pure magic.
Grown from the psychic emanations of ancient spirits.

paradigmAffinities.description: Stone of the void between stars
paradigmAffinities.lore: Blackstone remembers the silence before creation.
The finest metal in dwarven holds
Light as silk
Metal of the gods
Forged by divine smiths for heroes to wield.
Cooled in the River Styx
Sacred to Roman gods
Wood that remembers being a tree
Pure crystallized chaos. Incredibly powerful
Wyrdstone fell with the comet
The lifeblood of the Imperium\'s war machine.
The ceramite of power armor
Standard construction material of the far future.
Each scale is a shield that once protected a god of fire.
Dragon bones remember millennia of hoarded wisdom.
A phoenix feather has died and been reborn a thousand times.
Freely given unicorn hair holds the purest magic.

paradigmAffinities.description: Hide of the king of serpents
paradigmAffinities.lore: Even in death
Troll hide keeps regenerating. Best not to think about it.
Pillars of bone that once held up titans.
Demon bone whispers temptations to all who touch it.
An angel\'s feather carries the weight of heaven.
Even destroyed
Vampire ash hungers still
The beast within never truly dies.
Kraken ink holds memories of the abyss.
These bones held up seas.
Nothing stops a behemoth. Its hide remembers.
The sphinx\'s riddle persists beyond its asker.
From these ashes
Cut off one head
A manticore\'s spine delivers agony with every touch.

paradigmAffinities.description: Feathers of the king of beasts
paradigmAffinities.lore: Griffons are royalty among creatures.
Fey silver shimmers with dreams and lies.
Goblin gold always returns to its makers
Think happy thoughts
Fairy wings catch light that hasn\'t been born yet.
Changeling skin remembers every form it wore.
Dryad bark still dreams of deep roots and high branches.
Nymph tears hold the full depth of fey emotion.
Satyr horn still echoes with wild pipes.

paradigmAffinities.description: Matter that doesn\'t interact with light
paradigmAffinities.lore: Most of the universe is dark matter. It does not notice us.
A teaspoon weighs as much as a mountain.
Strange matter converts everything it touches. Handle with care.
At the smallest scales
It is whatever you need it to be
Every facet shows a different future.
Looking through paradox glass
Entropy always wins. This is entropy given form.
The opposite of decay. Life fighting back against the void.
Before anything is something
Some things are fated. This is what fate looks like.
The world tree holds all realms in its branches.

paradigmAffinities.description: The clay from which life was made
paradigmAffinities.lore: The first clay

paradigmAffinities.description: Ash from the end of a world
paradigmAffinities.lore: This ash remembers the death of a universe.

paradigmAffinities.description: Stone from the moment of creation
paradigmAffinities.lore: When the universe began
